meanings.definition: A person who is unconventional or slightly strange in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The town was known for its colorful eccentrics who always stood out.
meanings.sent2: She was considered one of the local eccentrics due to her unique fashion sense.
meanings.sent3: The group of eccentrics at the party made everyone laugh with their quirky dance moves.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of ordinary people, she shone like a brilliant eccentric.
meanings.sent5: The eccentric artist's studio was a chaotic masterpiece of creativity.

meanings.definition: Not placed centrally or not having its axis or other part placed centrally.
meanings.sent1: The eccentric wheel caused the car to wobble on the bumpy road.
meanings.sent2: The painting looked off-balance with its eccentric composition.
meanings.sent3: The eccentric clock on the wall always confused visitors with its unusual design.
meanings.sent4: Her eccentric hairstyle made her stand out in a sea of traditional looks.
meanings.sent5: The eccentric orbit of the comet puzzled astronomers around the world.
